metadata.notes: Leading cause of death worldwide, often caused by blocked coronary arteries

definition: death of heart muscle tissue due to insufficient blood supply, causing chest pain and potentially fatal complications

metadata.notes: Often called the 'silent killer' because it typically has no symptoms

definition: persistently elevated blood pressure that increases risk of heart disease, stroke, and kidney problems

metadata.notes: Can be caused by bacteria, viruses, or other pathogens

definition: infection that inflames air sacs in lungs, causing cough with phlegm, fever, chills, and difficulty breathing

metadata.notes: Primarily caused by smoking, affects millions worldwide

definition: chronic obstructive pulmonary disease causing airflow blockage and breathing problems, often from smoking

metadata.notes: Type 1 is autoimmune, Type 2 is often lifestyle-related

definition: chronic condition where blood sugar levels are too high due to insulin problems, causing frequent urination and thirst

metadata.notes: Can cause rapid heartbeat, weight loss, and anxiety

definition: condition where thyroid gland produces too much hormone, causing rapid metabolism, weight loss, and nervousness

metadata.notes: Time-critical emergency requiring immediate medical attention

definition: sudden interruption of blood flow to the brain causing brain cell death and potential paralysis or speech problems

metadata.notes: Progressive neurodegenerative disorder affecting movement

definition: progressive nervous system disorder causing tremors, stiffness, and difficulty with movement and coordination

metadata.notes: Most common cause of dementia in elderly

definition: progressive brain disorder causing memory loss, confusion, and eventual inability to carry out simple tasks

metadata.notes: Affects joints symmetrically, unlike osteoarthritis

definition: autoimmune disease causing chronic inflammation of joints, leading to pain, swelling, and eventual joint deformity

metadata.notes: Can affect multiple organ systems, often has butterfly rash

definition: autoimmune disease where immune system attacks healthy tissues, causing inflammation in skin, joints, and organs

metadata.notes: Seasonal outbreaks occur annually, vaccine available

definition: contagious viral infection causing fever, body aches, cough, and fatigue, typically lasting 1-2 weeks

metadata.notes: Can be latent or active, requires long-term antibiotic treatment

definition: bacterial infection primarily affecting lungs, causing persistent cough, weight loss, and night sweats

metadata.notes: Can become chronic and lead to liver cirrhosis or cancer

definition: inflammation of the liver often caused by viral infection, leading to jaundice, fatigue, and abdominal pain

metadata.notes: Strongly associated with smoking, leading cause of cancer death

definition: malignant tumor originating in lungs or bronchi, often causing persistent cough, chest pain, and weight loss

metadata.notes: Second most common cancer in women, screening important for early detection

definition: malignant tumor in breast tissue, often detected as a lump, causing changes in breast shape or skin texture

metadata.notes: Often caused by H. pylori bacteria or NSAIDs

definition: open sore in stomach lining causing burning pain, nausea, and potential bleeding if untreated

metadata.notes: Chronic inflammatory condition affecting the colon

definition: chronic inflammatory disease of the colon causing bloody diarrhea, abdominal pain, and urgency

metadata.notes: Can cause excruciating pain when passing through urinary tract

definition: formation of hard deposits in kidneys causing severe flank pain, nausea, and blood in urine

metadata.notes: Progressive loss of kidney function, may require dialysis

definition: gradual loss of kidney function over time, leading to waste buildup and eventual need for dialysis or transplant

metadata.notes: Common chronic skin condition, often starts in childhood

definition: chronic skin condition causing red, itchy, inflamed patches that may weep or become scaly

metadata.notes: Most deadly form of skin cancer, often appears as changing moles

definition: aggressive form of skin cancer developing from pigment cells, appearing as dark, irregular, changing moles

metadata.notes: Common mental health condition affecting mood and daily functioning

definition: persistent feelings of sadness, hopelessness, and loss of interest in activities, affecting daily functioning

metadata.notes: Characterized by alternating episodes of mania and depression

definition: mental health condition causing extreme mood swings between manic highs and depressive lows

metadata.notes: Common in postmenopausal women, increases fracture risk

definition: condition where bones become weak and brittle, increasing risk of fractures from minor falls or stress

metadata.notes: Can be caused by iron deficiency, chronic disease, or blood loss

definition: condition with insufficient healthy red blood cells or hemoglobin, causing fatigue, weakness, and pale skin

metadata.notes: Cancer of blood-forming tissues, affects white blood cells

definition: cancer of blood-forming tissues causing overproduction of abnormal white blood cells, leading to infections and bleeding
